preface.title: OpenStack API Reference
preface.para: Use the following OpenStack APIs in your OpenStack cloud: Identity Service API v2.0, Identity Admin API v2.0, Identity Service API v2.0 extensions, Compute API v2, Compute API v2 extensions, Image Service API v2.0, Image Service API v1, Block Storage Service API v2.0, Networking API v2.0, and Object Storage API v1. You must install the packages for each API separately. After you authenticate through the Identity Service API, you can use the other APIs and extensions to launch server instances, create images, assign metadata to instances and images, create containers and objects, and complete other actions in your OpenStack cloud.
To get started with the APIs, see the OpenStack API Quick Start. For detailed information, read the references for each API.

chapter.title: Identity Service API v2.0
chapter.para: Gets an authentication token that permits access to the Compute API for 24 hours.

chapter.title: Identity Service Admin API v2.0
chapter.para: Gets an authentication token that permits access to the Compute API for 24 hours.

chapter.title: Identity Service API v2.0 Extensions
chapter.para: Adds capabilities to the core Identity Service Admin API v2.0.
Query the Identity Service API to list available extensions with a &GET; request to v2.0/extensions.

chapter.title: Compute API v2
chapter.para: Launches virtual machines from images or images stored on persistent volumes. API v1.1 is identical to API v2.

section.title: Versions
section.para: Get information about a specific version of the API.

section.title: Extensions
section.para: Lists all available extensions and gets details for a specified extension. Extensions introduce features and vendor-specific functionality in the API without requiring a version change.

section.title: Limits
section.para: Gets rate and absolute limits. from one OpenStack Compute service deployment to another.

section.title: Servers
section.para: Lists, creates, gets details for, updates, and deletes servers.

section.title: Server Metadata
section.para: Sets, lists, gets details for, and deletes server metadata or metadata items.

section.title: Server Addresses
section.para: Lists addresses for a specified server or a specified server and network.

section.title: Server Actions
section.para: Performs actions for a specified server, including change administrator password, reboot, rebuild, resize, and create image from server.

section.title: Flavors
section.para: Lists available flavors and gets details for a specified flavor. A flavor is a hardware configuration for a server. Each flavor is a unique combination of disk space and memory capacity.

section.title: Images
section.para: Lists available images, gets details for a specified image, and deletes an image.
Also, sets, lists, gets details for, and deletes image metadata.
An image is a collection of files that you use to create or rebuild a server. By default, operators provide pre-built operating system images. You can also create custom images: See .

section.title: Image Metadata
section.para: Sets, lists, gets details for, and deletes image metadata or metadata items.

chapter.title: Compute API v2 Extensions
chapter.para: Adds capabilities to the core Compute API. Use extensions to add features, MIME types, actions, states, headers, parameters, and resources to the core API. Query the Compute API to list available extensions with a &GET; request to v2/extensions.

section.title: Server Admin Actions
section.para: Permits administrators to perform actions on a server.

section.title: Guest Agents
section.para: Creates, updates, and deletes guest agents. Use guest agents to access files on the disk, configure networking, or run other applications or scripts in the guest while it runs. This hypervisor-specific extension is not currently enabled for KVM. Use of guest agents is possible only if the underlying service provider uses the Xen driver.

section.title: Host Aggregates
section.para: Creates and manages host aggregates. An aggregate assigns metadata to groups of compute nodes. Aggregates are only visible to the cloud provider.

section.title: Cloudpipe
section.para: Manages virtual vpns for projects.

section.title: Server Console Output
section.para: Gets the output from the console log for a server.

section.title: Server VNC Console
section.para: Accesses a VNC console for a specified server.

section.title: Server Extended Create
section.para: Shows extra information when you create a server.

section.title: Server Force Delete or Restore
section.para: Restores or force-deletes a server when you deploy nova with deferred delete on.

section.title: Server Diagnostics
section.para: Gets the usage data for a server.

section.title: Disk Config
section.para: Extends servers and images with a diskConfig attribute.

section.title: Extended Availability Zones
section.para: Shows the instance availability zone for compute nodes (nova-compute). Internal services appear in their own internal availability zone.

section.title: Image Size
section.para: Lists details for available images or gets details for a specified image. Includes the OS-EXT-IMG-SIZE:size extended attribute, which shows the image size.

section.title: Server IP Type
section.para: Shows the type of the IP addresses assigned to an instance. Type is either fixed or floating.

section.title: Server Extended Attributes
section.para: Shows metadata for servers.

section.title: Server Extended Status
section.para: Shows extended status information, vm_state, task_state, and power_state, in detailed server responses.

section.title: Fixed IPs
section.para: Shows data for a specified fixed IP, such as host name, CIDR, and address. Also, reserves or frees a fixed IP.

section.title: Flavor Access
section.para: Creates and gets details for private flavors. Also, lists, adds and removes tenants' access to private flavors.

section.title: Flavor Extra-Specs
section.para: Lists, creates, and updates the extra-specs or keys for a flavor.

section.title: Flavors with rxtx_factor Extended Attribute
section.para: Creates a flavor, gets details for a specified flavor, and lists details for available flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor extended attribute, related to configured bandwidth cap values.

section.title: Flavors with Extended Attributes
section.para: Creates a flavor, gets details for a flavor, and lists details for available flavors. Includes the rxtx_factor, OS-FLV-EXT-DATA:ephemeral, and swap extended attributes.

section.title: Flavors Create or Delete
section.para: Creates or deletes flavors.

section.title: Floating IP DNS
section.para: Manages DNS records associated with IP addresses allocated by the Floating IPs extension. Requests are dispatched to a DNS driver selected at startup.

section.title: Floating IP Pools
section.para: Manages groups of floating IPs.

section.title: Floating IPs Bulk
section.para: Bulk creates, deletes, and lists floating IPs. By default, the pool is named nova. Use the os-floating-ip-pools extension to view available pools.

section.title: Floating IPs
section.para: Assigns and allocates floating IP addresses to instances that run in an OpenStack cloud.

section.title: Hosts
section.para: Manages physical hosts.

section.title: Hypervisors
section.para: Displays extra statistical information from the machine that hosts the hypervisor through the API for the hypervisor (XenAPI or KVM/libvirt).

section.title: Server List Actions or Get Action Details
section.para: Permits all users to list available actions for a specified server. Permits administrators to get details for a specified action for a specified server.

section.title: Keypairs
section.para: Generates, imports, and deletes SSH keys.

section.title: Servers Multiple Create
section.para: Creates one or more servers with an optional reservation ID. The request and response examples show how to create multiple servers with or without a reservation ID.

section.title: Networks
section.para: Shows network information for or deletes networks. Also, disassociates a network from a project if you use vlan mode.

section.title: Quota Sets
section.para: Permits administrators, depending on policy settings, to view quotas for a tenant and view and update default quotas.

section.title: Server Rescue
section.para: Rescues or unrescues a server.

section.title: Scheduler Hints
section.para: Provides information directly to the scheduler when you create a server.

section.title: Security Groups
section.para: Creates, modifies, and deletes security groups and rules.

section.title: Server Password
section.para: This extension retrieves and resets the encrypted admin password set through metadata service.

section.title: Server Start or Stop
section.para: Starts or stops a server.

section.title: Manage Services
section.para: Lists, enables, and disables Nova services in all hosts.

section.title: Usage Reports
section.para: Reports usage statistics on compute and storage resources.

section.title: Used Limits
section.para: Extends limits to show the usage of per project limits. Shows information such as RAM or instance quotas usage.

section.title: Virtual Interfaces
section.para: Lists the virtual interfaces for a specified server instance.

section.title: Volume Attachments
section.para: Attaches volumes created through the volume API to server instances. Also, lists volume attachments for a server instance, gets volume details for a volume attachment, and deletes a volume attachment.

section.title: Volume Extension to Compute
section.para: Manages volumes and snapshots for use with the Compute API.

chapter.title: Image Service API 2.0
chapter.para: Creates, updates, and deletes image metadata records. Also, uploads and downloads raw image data.

chapter.title: Image Service API v1
chapter.para: Loads images for use at launch time by the Compute API. Also, assigns metadata to images. Some cloud implementations do not expose this API and offer pretested images only.

chapter.title: Block Storage Service API v2.0
chapter.para: Manages volumes and snapshots for use with the Block Storage Service API (cinder services).

chapter.title: Networking API v2.0
chapter.para: Provides virtual networking services among devices that are managed by the OpenStack compute service. The Networking API v2.0 combines the API v1.1 functionality with some essential Internet Protocol Address Management (IPAM). Enables users to associate IP address blocks and other network configuration settings with a neutron network. You can choose a specific IP address from the block or let neutron choose the first available IP address. For more information, see OpenStack Networking API v2.0 Reference

section.title: Networks
section.para: Lists, creates, deletes, and updates neutron networks.

section.title: Subnets
section.para: Lists, creates, removes, and updates subnet resources.

section.title: Ports
section.para: Lists, creates, removes, and updates ports.

chapter.title: Object Storage API v1
chapter.para: Manages the accounts, containers, and objects in the object storage system.
